clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Intraoperative Dexmedetomidine on Lung Protection Following Thoracic Aorta Surgery With Hypothermic Circulatory Arrest: a Randomized Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Intraoperative Dexmedetomidine on Lung Protection Following Thoracic Aorta Surgery With Hypothermic Circulatory Arrest: a Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Dexmedetomidine has been known to protect the lung against inflammation and oxidative stress in diverse clinical settings. The investigators aimed to investigate the lung protective effect of dexmedetomidine in patients undergoing thoracic aortic surgery with hypothermic circulatory arrest, which is associated with systemic inflammatory response, and oxidative stress.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients will be divided into 2 groups; dexmedetomidine group and control group. Dexmedetomidine group will receive dexmedetomidine during and after thoracic artery surgery. And control group will receive the same amount of normal saline instead. Analyzing patients lung function and serum factors, which indicates the degree of systemic inflammatory responses and oxidative stress, The investigators will investigate the protective effect of dexmedetomidine on lung.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of lung oxygenation from baseline to 24 hr after reperfusion

primary_outcome.description: Lung oxygenation will be assessed by arterial blood gas analysis

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of lung compliance from baseline to 24 hr after reperfusion
primary_outcome.time_frame: after induction of anesthesia / after reperfusion 1hr / after reperfusion 6hr / after reperfusion 12hr / after reperfusion 24hr
primary_outcome.description: Lung compliance will be displayed on the ventilator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing thoracic aorta surgery with hypothermic circulatory arrest, over 20-of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unstable vital sign before surgery
- Severe pulmonary disease requiring consistent treatment
- Illiterate
- Pregnancy
